messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Gordon -- Thank you for the hard work!
messages.msgSnippet: The Mito articles begin with issue #582 from July last year. That is the only one done so far, but I hope to do the entire series. The Hirata article is from
messages.messageBody:
The Mito articles begin with issue #582 from July last year. That is
the only one done so far, but I hope to do the entire series. The
Hirata article is from issue #496.

Gordon

messages.subject: Re: Gordon -- Thank you for the hard work!
messages.msgSnippet: Not a prob -- I wish there was a way to be able to learn to read the language that didn t take ten years and way too many brain cells! LOL I need to find these
messages.messageBody:
Not a prob -- I wish there was a way to be able to learn to read the
language that didn't take ten years and way too many brain cells! LOL
I need to find these issues (for the illustrations) along the way as I
only became a member this year. I'll have to have Rich look around
Tokyo while he is there (as if he didn't have anything else better to
do)!
Thanks again!
Pete

Gordon Robson wrote:
>
> Thanks Pete. Given the amount of time it takes to do this kind of
> work in relation to how much you get paid makes translation a rather
> thankless task. Getting some strokes every now and then makes it all
> worth while. So thanks for this. Next up is Higo Hirata Hikozo with
> the same kind of very in depth analysis. There is more Mito Kinko on
> the way as well.
>
> Gordon
>
> On Oct 16, 2006, at 1:41 AM, klepet33319 wrote:
>
> > I received the NBTHK AB translations of 'Elementary Course in Sword
> > Furniture and Fittings (128)' on Mito Kinko by Fukushi Shigeo this
> > morning and I can see where you were coming from in your comments on
> > the translation. Work well done and much appreciated. I have to laugh
> > a bit at the title 'Elementary' as it's very in depth and it really
> > puts into perspective how much there is to learn in this field. Not
> > being able to read Japanese of course puts so much out of reach for so
> > many of us that work such as yours is most highly valued. It also puts
> > into perspective just how much scholarship there is in what men like
> > Fukushi accomplish. I will be looking forward to your future
> > endeavors.
> > Pete Klein
> > PS: To all -- if you are not a member of the NBTHK AB it is well worth
> > it, IMHO.
> >
> >
> >
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Gordon -- Thank you for the hard work!
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks Pete. Given the amount of time it takes to do this kind of work in relation to how much you get paid makes translation a rather thankless task. Getting
messages.messageBody:
Thanks Pete. Given the amount of time it takes to do this kind of
work in relation to how much you get paid makes translation a rather
thankless task. Getting some strokes every now and then makes it all
worth while. So thanks for this. Next up is Higo Hirata Hikozo with
the same kind of very in depth analysis. There is more Mito Kinko on
the way as well.

Gordon

On Oct 16, 2006, at 1:41 AM, klepet33319 wrote:

> I received the NBTHK AB translations of 'Elementary Course in Sword
> Furniture and Fittings (128)' on Mito Kinko by Fukushi Shigeo this
> morning and I can see where you were coming from in your comments on
> the translation. Work well done and much appreciated. I have to laugh
> a bit at the title 'Elementary' as it's very in depth and it really
> puts into perspective how much there is to learn in this field. Not
> being able to read Japanese of course puts so much out of reach for so
> many of us that work such as yours is most highly valued. It also puts
> into perspective just how much scholarship there is in what men like
> Fukushi accomplish. I will be looking forward to your future
> endeavors.
> Pete Klein
> PS: To all -- if you are not a member of the NBTHK AB it is well worth
> it, IMHO.
>
>
>



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Gordon -- Thank you for the hard work!
messages.msgSnippet: I received the NBTHK AB translations of Elementary Course in Sword Furniture and Fittings (128) on Mito Kinko by Fukushi Shigeo this morning and I can see
messages.messageBody:
I received the NBTHK AB translations of 'Elementary Course in Sword
Furniture and Fittings (128)' on Mito Kinko by Fukushi Shigeo this
morning and I can see where you were coming from in your comments on
the translation. Work well done and much appreciated. I have to laugh
a bit at the title 'Elementary' as it's very in depth and it really
puts into perspective how much there is to learn in this field. Not
being able to read Japanese of course puts so much out of reach for so
many of us that work such as yours is most highly valued. It also puts
into perspective just how much scholarship there is in what men like
Fukushi accomplish. I will be looking forward to your future endeavors.
Pete Klein
PS: To all -- if you are not a member of the NBTHK AB it is well worth
it, IMHO.
